summary: This is an email chain regarding the transmission of an immunity authorization letter. It involves a U.S. Attorney's Office employee and a recipient named Sheila, with copies to other DOJ personnel. The document highlights procedural communication around granting immunity in an unspecified matter.

persons.name: Sheila
persons.context: The sender of an email who is transmitting a signed immunity authorization letter as an attachment to a U.S. Attorney's Office employee.

persons.name: Healy, Mary
persons.context: Copied on the initial email regarding the immunity letter, indicating involvement in the Criminal Division (CRM) of the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Barber, Tina
persons.context: Copied on the initial email regarding the immunity letter, indicating involvement in the Criminal Division (CRM) of the Department of Justice.

connections.description: Sheila's email regarding an immunity letter was copied to Mary Healy, indicating a professional or case-related connection.
Sheila's email regarding an immunity letter was copied to Tina Barber, indicating a professional or case-related connection.
Both are listed with the same departmental suffix (CRM) and were copied on the same official email, indicating they are colleagues within the DOJ's Criminal Division.

events.title: Transmission of Immunity Authorization Letter
events.description: An email chain documents the sending and re-sending of an attached immunity authorization letter from a correspondent named Sheila to a U.S. Attorney's Office employee.

keyFacts: An immunity authorization letter was being transmitted via email on June 25, 2008.
The communication involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office and the DOJ's Criminal Division (CRM).
The document is a procedural record showing the logistical exchange of a significant legal document (an immunity letter).
